intro: Lacinaria elongata, commonly known as the longleaf lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It has a distinctive leaf-like structure with a thallus that is usually green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a dense, crust-like growth that can be found on bark, rocks, or soil surfaces. It is characterized by its elongated, lobed lobes and a central vein that runs along its length. Lacinaria elongata plays an important role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in forest ecosystems.
